{About Us}

We want to make the world a better place, through data. This means helping organizations and individuals to better explore, understand, and use information.

Our primary focuses are consulting and teaching. Though the combination may appear unusual, we approach consulting in the exact same way we approach teaching: with the end goal of empowering the client.

When we consult, we don't just provide answers like traditional consultants - we provide analytical approaches for asking the right questions and tools for uncovering answers.

When we teach, we don't just teach methods like traditional teachers - we teach context and challenge students to think (and learn) on their own.

Data Science for Social Good

As part of our commitment to making our corner of the world just a little better, we offer reduced rates for budget-constrained organizations which are involved in delivering a “social good”. If you are a public sector institution, NGO, academic institution, or public benefit corporation exploring the potential of data science or machine learning to help achieve your mission of making a positive impact in the world, we would love to hear from you!

    Anastasiia

    I am 20 years old  and I am pursuing my BA in Economics at Lviv Polytechnik National University.  In 2018 I completed an internship in Israel in a healthcare project. During the internship, I had a chance to try myself in various positions. I dedicated myself to exploring cardiovascular diseases and cancer. My main responsibilities were to create interactive data visualization, find insights and build trends. At this point, I found Inspiration in R and its tools. After the internship, I decided to continue my career as a Data Analyst and dive into data and R capabilities. I have participated in Google Science Fair and  three Google Code Ins where I took part in various projects, ranging from web application development to blockchain exploration. My hobbies include reading books, tennis, running . I am a big fan of Formula 1, learning, and sometimes I spend my spare time as a volunteer teaching children coding basics.

    Ben Brew

    I am originally from Gainesville, Florida and earned a BA in Economics from The University of the South in Tennessee (2012). I graduated with a Master’s in Economics from the Paris School of Economics and the Sorbonne in France (2015) and spent the following summer as a data science fellow at the University of Chicago's Data Science for Social Good program. I worked for five years as a bioinformatician in the Genetics and Genome Biology Lab at the Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto. In my free time, I enjoy playing basketball, cycling, and watching the Toronto Raptors.

    Clement

    My name is Clement Bempong Danso, a.k.a Quoda. I’m currently a Health Information Officer for the Ghana Ministry of Health, as well as a recognized data auditor for the Ghana Health Service (periodically auditing health data related to Global Fund programs (Malaria, TB, and HIV Data). Since 2018, I’ve been working around health data management and the implementation of health information systems such as DHIS2, ODK/ODK-X, and OpenMRS. Besides, I’ve built expertise in areas such as web application development using Python/Django, as well as Linux server administration. Hence I’m comfortable handling Linux servers for DHIS2 instances as well as ODK/ODK-X instances.

    Joe Brew

    I am a data scientist, epidemiologist, and economist. I have worked with the Florida Department of Health (USA), the Chicago Department of Public Health (USA), the Barcelona Public Health Agency (Spain), the Tigray Regional Health Bureau (Ethiopia) and the Manhiça Health Research Center (Mozambique). My research focuses on the economics of malaria and its elimination. I earned my BA at Sewanee: The University of the South (2008), an MA at the Institut Catholique de Paris (2009) and an MPH at the Kobenhavns Universitet (2013). I am passionate about international development, infectious disease surveillance, teaching, running, and pizza.

Xing
  • CV

    Xing Brew

    I'm one of the co-founders of Databrew. I graduated with a BA in International Relations from the University of Toronto (2012) and MSc in the Sustainable Local Development from the University of Paris-Sorbonne (2015). I am passionate about using data-driven, evidence based methods to do some good in the world, particularly in the areas climate change and public health. At Databrew, my responsibilities range from long term business planning, to managing projects, to coding survey forms in ODK used by fieldworkers in Africa. When I'm not in front of my computer, I love spending time with my kids, swimming, practicing Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, and being in nature.
